ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: In class we improved vocabulary, writing, reading, and verbal skills in Spanish. In particular, by the end of the course I became more comfortable using different tenses in Spanish and using connector words to translate my written skills to speech.
This class really helped me identify the gaps in my Spanish knowledge, but did so in a way that allowed me to learn a lot and get many opportunities to speak the language.
Reviewed basic Spanish concepts and learned intermediate Spanish topics. Gained a stronger grasp on subjective verb tenses.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Strengths: Prof. Cividanes, reading/movie content was interesting, following the book chapters (made it easier to study), dialogue format

Weaknesses: the pace could be difficult for someone who is not comfortable with Spanish, but Prof. Cividanes was very helpful and accommodating to everyone.

Strengths: Encouraging professor, practiced speaking at most classes, learned a lot over the semester
Weaknesses: Sometimes course information would be a bit disorganized, since there were assignments on the Supersite and Canvas and files posted in our class Canvas and the umbrella class Canvas.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The asynchronous and synchronous with breakout room format was helpful. It was engaging without being overwhelming-- of course in person dialogue would be better for us to learn but I feel this is the best with what can be done virtually.
Asynchronous days are huge. Having class 5 days a week is extremely stressful, but knowing that you can learn at your own pace for at least two of those helps alleviate some stress.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes, especially with Professor Cividanes. The workload may seem like a lot at first, but once you set up a daily schedule and do the work consistently it's very manageable. Professor Cividanes was always there to offer help and make the course more manageable for people of all levels. Overall, I think the format of the course is the best it could be to learn this level of Spanish.

Spanish 130 with Professor Cividanes is great! Shes an excellent teacher and clearly loves to teach. She is always open to answering and explaining students questions. She is also kind and understanding.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
